  • Ready To Land - Reference Guide

Ready to Land - Reference Guide

  • Carry out your RTL duties correctly by following this guide
  • JC Cabin Supervisor is responsible to check that RTL duties are completed in Business Class
  • Ensure that all unused seals are returned to the Amenities container

Glossary

Flight Example
Turnaround DXB-BOM-DXB
Transit (with/without a Crew change) DXB-SIN-MEL
Terminating DXB-LHR
DXB JFK- DXB

Aircraft Equipment

Aircraft Equipment
All Flights

  • Return all aircraft equipment to original stowages
    • E.g. Onboard wheelchair, Easy glide and belt, infant/extension seatbelts, baby bassinets, KiS printer etc.

Blankets/ Duvets and Mattresses

Blankets/ Duvets and Mattresses
Before Landing (-30mins)

All Flights

  • Check Service Sequence notes/Station Information manual regarding transit information
  • Collect used and unused blankets, duvets and mattresses
  • Allow customer to keep blanket, duvet if requested
  • Put used and unused blankets, duvets and mattresses in separate blanket collection bags
  • Maximum of 3 filled blanket bags to be placed in a lavatory
  • Make sure the toilet seat is down

After Landing

Turnaround

  • Place used blanket, duvet and mattress bags in hatracks.

    • Terminating and DXB

    • Collect remaining used and unused blankets, duvets and mattresses
    • Remove any opened bundle(s) of blankets, duvets and mattresses, from hatracks/closets and place in appropriate blanket collection bags
    • Remove any closed bundles of blankets, duvets and mattresses from hatracks/closets
    • Make sure all blanket bags are removed from lavatories and hatracks
    • Place filled blanket bags and closed bundles between rows of seats
    • Do not block any aircraft doors with bags
    Note: Crew must collect all used and unused blankets/duvets and mattresses. This is to ensure a 100% equal exchange for Caterers

    Carts, Containers and Bags

    Carts, Containers and Bags
    All Flights

    • Check Service Sequence notes and if applicable, complete bar and Duty Free paperwork
    • Return all bar and Duty Free carts and containers to original locations
    • Return all items to bar and Duty Free carts and containers
      • E.g. unused bar paperwork, bar waste bags, hand held computers etc.
    • Seal all carts and containers with alcohol/Duty Free
      • E.g. Bar and Duty Free carts and containers
    Transit, Terminating and DXB

    • Seal all carts except: clearance, equipment, glass and bulk food carts
    • Seal all bags and containers (except headphones)
    Note: If catering is loaded for return/onward sector and there is a change of crew:
    • Seal meal carts/containers
      • Leave ovens empty for the next crew. Do not load return sector meals
    • Make a note on the Crew Handover form

    Chilled compartments /Fridges

    Chilled compartments /Fridges
    Turnaround and Transit
    Tetra/fresh juices:
    • Leave opened and unopened Tetra/fresh juices inside chilled compartments/fridges
    Wine:
    • Return open and closed bottles to containers/bars
      • Use wine stoppers, if required
      • Do not leave wines in chilled compartments/fridges
    Food:
    • Remove food items if transit with a crew and catering exchange
    Terminating
    Tetra/fresh juices:
    • Dispose of opened Tetra/fresh juices
    • Leave unopened Tetra juices inside chilled compartments/fridges
    Wine:
    • Return open and closed bottles to containers/bars
      • Use wine stoppers, if required
      • Do not leave wines in chilled compartments/fridges
    Food:
    • Remove food items
    DXB
    Tetra/fresh juices:
    • Dispose of opened Tetra/fresh juices
    • Return all unopened Tetra juices to Juice/Mineral water containers.
      • If no container available, leave neatly on galley top
    Wine:
    • Flights from Europe:
      • Close bottles that are half full or more with wine stopper/cork/screw top
      • Return to original stowage
    • All other flights:
      • Dispose of opened wine
    • Return all unopened wines to original carts/containers
    Note: When required, discreetly empty liquids in a lavatory (toilet bowl only)
    • Make sure the lavatory is left clean after disposing liquids
    DXB
    Not enough time for juice disposal:
    • Close juice lids and place in plastic drawer
      • Don't overfill the drawer
      • Put drawer in bulk food / meal clearance cart

    Crew Handover Form

    Crew Handover Form
    Transit with change of crew and Terminating
    • Make a note of any important information relevant for next Crew
      • E.g. Return/Onward sector catering loaded, Customer info, Defects etc.

    Customer personal items stored in the fridge/chilled compartments/wardrobes/closet

    Customer personal items stored in the fridge/chilled compartments/wardrobes/closet
    Before Landing (-30mins)

    Transit with change of crew
    Customer remaining on board:

    • Keep item inside fridge/chilled compartment/wardrobe/closet
    • Make a note on Crew Handover Form
    Customer disembarking:
    • Return item
    Turnaround, Terminating and DXB
    • Return item

    Flower Display

    Flower Display
    • Check Station Information Manual
    After Landing, if required:
    • Collect all flower displays from the bulk head/ lavatories
    • Place flowers inside an EK plastic bag
    • Leave the bag on the First Class galley top for disposal by Catering staff

    Giveaway Items - Socks, eyeshades, kit bags, and Children’s toys

    Giveaway Items - Socks, eyeshades, kit bags, and Children’s toys
    After landing
    Terminating and DXB
    • Collect unused giveaways such as socks, eyeshades, and kit bags
    • Return to Giveaways cart/container/bag and seal
      • If Giveaways cart/bag or container full, place in a EK plastic bag and seal
    Kit Bags - used/opened
    • Put in a blanket collection bag
    Children’s toys – unused
    • Return to Children’s toy bags in Economy

    Headphones

    Headphones
    After landing
    Transit
    • Check Service Sequence notes, if required, collect headphones
    • Follow guidelines for Terminating and DXB
    Terminating and DXB
    • Collect used and unused headphones
    • Place used and unused headphones in separate bags/containers
    Defective headphone
    • Place a defective sticker on an EK plastic bag
    • Put defective headphone in the bag
    • Place bag in used headphone container/bag
    Children’s Headphones
    • Return used and unused children’s headphones to the Children’s headphone container in Economy Class
    Defective headphone
    • Place a defective sticker on an EK plastic bag
    • Put defective children’s headphone in the bag
    • Place bag inside Children’s headphone container in Economy Class
      • Note: Do not throw away defective headphone/defective children’s headphones

    Ice Drawers

    Ice Drawers
    All Flights
    • Remove items and return to original stowages
      • E.g. Ice buckets and tongs

    Juice Order Form

    Juice Order Form
    Transit and Terminating
    • Check Service Sequence notes and complete a juice order form, if required
    • Count unopened Tetra juices and complete the form to top up to standard quantities

    Landing cards / Fast track cards/ Health forms/ Delayed Baggage forms

    Landing cards / Fast track cards/ Health forms/ Delayed Baggage forms
    All Flights
    • Put unused cards/forms back in the Cabin dress materials stowage
    • Count unopened Tetra juices and complete the form to top up to standard quantities

    Lavatory Products - Fragrances, Combs, Dental Kits, Hand Creams

    Lavatory Products - Fragrances, Combs, Dental Kits, Hand Creams
    After landing
    Turnaround and Transit with a crew change
    • Place lavatory products in a galley stowage
    • When cleaning completed, return lavatory products to lavatories
    Terminating
    • Return fragrances to Toiletries container
    • Return other products to Amenities/Toiletries container
    • Seal container/cart
    DXB
    • Keep fragrances in lavatory
      • RTB team will check and replenish
    • Return other products to amenities/toiletries container
    • Seal container/cart

    Linen

    Linen
    All Flights
    Opened linen
    • Put in linen bag
    Unopened linen packs
    • Put in a cart/container
      • If linen is placed in a closet, remove after landing and leave neatly in galley

    Lounge – A380 Business Class

    Lounge – A380 Business Class
    Before Landing (-30mins)
    All Flights
    • Dismantle lounge
    • Return items to original stowages
    • Clean:
      • Bar top and display cabinet
      • LCD unit
      • Shelves
      • Work area
      • Remain on Board (ROB) items
    • Dismantle shelves (if applicable)
      • Business Class Cabin Supervisor and a GR1 remove and stow shelves
    After Landing
    All Flights
    • Replace Lounge protective covers

    Magazines

    Magazines
    After Landing
    Turnarounds
    • Remove magazines from magazine racks
    • Return magazines to racks after cleaning completed
      • B777 : Return magazines to aft JC magazine racks after boarding completed
    Terminating and DXB
    • Collect all magazines from magazine racks and cabin (i.e. seat areas)
      • Put magazines in magazines bags, close and seal

    Magic Box - Hot Beverage Preparation Drawer

    Magic Box - Hot Beverage Preparation Drawer
    Transit (with change of crew), Terminating stations
    • Replenish items for next crew and leave in galley stowage/chilled compartment
      • E.g. 6 small plates and 24 teaspoons, 5 sugar holders (replenish sugar and sweetener)
    • Complete Crew Handover Form to inform next crew of location
    DXB Dismantle magic box:
    • Remove sugar from ‘magic box’ sugar holders and return to Dry Stores container
    • Leave sugar holders in magic box
    • Put teaspoons and plates in clearance carts
    • Return all recyclable items to appropriate stowages e.g. Amenities/Dry Stores container/Bars etc.
      • E.g. Swizzle sticks, napkins, tea bags, biscuits etc.

    Menus, Wine Lists, and Breakfast cards

    Menus, Wine Lists, and Breakfast cards
    Turnaround, Terminating and DXB
    Unwrapped/open menus, wine lists and breakfast cards
    • Throw away
    Unopened/closed menu packs, wine lists and breakfast cards
    • Return to menu bag
    Note: Do not prepare menus for next crew

    Mineral Water (small bottles) – B777 Business Class

    Lavatory Products - Fragrances, Combs, Dental Kits, Hand Creams
    After landing
    Terminating and DXB
    • Collect all unused small water bottles from seat pockets
    Terminating
    • Leave bottles neatly inside the wardrobe
    DXB
    • Put unused small water bottles in a Mineral water container
      • If no container available, leave neatly on galley top

    Preserves and Salad dressings

    Preserves and Salad dressings

    All Flights
    • Put unopened preserves and dressings in the Preserves and dressings container
    Note: Do not place salt and pepper shakers in this container

    R.O.B - Remain on Board Items - Service Equipment

    R.O.B - Remain on Board Items - Service Equipment

    All flights
    • Collect all unused small water bottles from seat pockets
      • E.g. Hot beverage flasks, bread tongs, cocktail shaker, muddler etc.
    • Return R.O.B sugar holders (including sugar/sweetener sachets) to original loading location
    • Return unused blanket collection, cabin tidy bags and trash compactor boxes to original locations
    Transit, Terminating
    • Clean silver trays for next crew
    • Make sure beverage makers and Espresso machines are left clean.
      • Remove used milk spout from Espresso machine
    • Ensure all R.O.B. items are washed thoroughly
      • E.g. Soup jugs, bread tongs, beverage flasks etc.
    DXB
    • Ensure R.O.B. items are rinsed
    After Landing
    • Remove all silver and service trays from stowages and place on the galley top

    Salt and Pepper

    Salt and Pepper

    All flights
    • Ensure all used and unused salt and pepper shakers are placed inside an equipment, meal clearance or bulk cart
      • Keep on a melamine tray or in a plastic drawer
    Note: Do notplace salt and pepper shakers with salad dressings/preserves
    Version 1 - May 2017
